maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the properties of an Azure Database Migration project.
The Get-AzureRmDataMigrationProject cmdlet retrieves the properties of an Azure Database Migration project.

maml:Description.maml:para: PSDataMigrationService Object.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The name of the project.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.

Data Migration Service Name.
DataMigrationService Resource Id.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.

PSDataMigrationService Object.
The name of the project.
The name of the resource group.
DataMigrationService Resource Id.
Data Migration Service Name.

maml:description.maml:para: System.String

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmDataMigrationProject -ServiceName testService -Name testProject -ResourceGroup testResourceGroup

dev:remarks.maml:para: The above example retrieves Azure Database Migration project named TestProject in the resource group called testResourceGroup and under service called testService
The above example retrieves the Azure Database Migration project based on PSProject object input parameter passed in.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the properties associated with an instance of the Azure Database Migration Service.

The Get-AzureRmDataMigrationService cmdlet retrieves the properties associated with an instance of the Azure Database Migration Service based on Service name and Azure Resource Group name as input parameters.

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the resource group.

The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Name of Data Migration Service.
The name of the resource group.
DataMigrationService Resource Id.

dev:remarks.maml:para: The above example retrieves the properties of the Azure Database Migration Service instance called testService.
The above example retrieves Azure Database Migration Services in the resource group called testResourceGroup.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get -AzureRmDataMigrationTask -TaskName myTestTask -ServiceName myTestService -ProjectName MyTestProject -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroup -Expand

dev:remarks.maml:para: The above example illustrates the use of Get-AzureRmDataMigrationTask cmdlet to retrieve the properties associated with an Azure Database Migration Service migration task based on task name passed in as input parameter
The above example illustrates the use of Get-AzureRmDataMigrationTask cmdlet to retrieve all of the migration tasks associated with PSProject object passed in as input parameter

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Connection Info object specifying the server type and name for connection.
The New-AzureRmDataMigrationConnectionInfo cmdlet creates new a Connection Info object specifying the server type for connection.

maml:Description.maml:para: Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Enum that describes server type to connect to. Currently supported values are SQL for SQL Server and SQLDB for SQL Azure Database.
Authentication type to use for connection. Possible values are SqlAuthentication and WindowsAuthentication
Server address\name to connect to.
Boolean indicating to guarantee that encryption takes place.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Enum that describes server type to connect to. Currently supported values are SQL for SQL Server and SQLDB for SQL Azure Database.
Authentication type to use for connection. Possible values are SqlAuthentication and WindowsAuthentication
Server address\name to connect to.
Boolean indicating to guarantee that encryption takes place.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmDmsConnInfo -ServerType SQL -DataSource mySourceServer -AuthType SqlAuthentication -TrustServerCertificate:$true

dev:remarks.maml:para: The preceding example creates a new Connection Info object providing SQL as ServerType parameter.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates the DatabaseInfo object for the Azure Database Migration Service, which specifies the database source for migration.
The New-AzureRmDataMigrationDatabaseInfo cmdlet creates the DatabaseInfo object that specifies the source database instance to be migrated. Database name is taken in as input parameter.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Source Database Name.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Source Database Name.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: The preceding example creates a new DatabaseInfo object for the source database AdventureWorks2016 .
This script assumes that you are already logged into your Azure account. You can confirm your login status by using the Get-AzureSubscription cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Azure Database Migration Service project.

The New-AzureRmDataMigrationProject cmdlet creates a new Azure Database Migration Service project. This cmdlet takes in all necessary parameters, such as the name of the Azure Resource Group, the name of Azure Data Migration Service in which new project is to be created, the region in which the project is to be created, the unique name of the new project, the source and target connection objects, and the target type object, as input for the list of databases to migrate. Use the New-AzureRmDataMigrationConnectionInfo cmdlet to create a new ConnectionInfo object for both the source and target connections. The list of Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataMigration.Models.DatabaseInfo is expected for selected databases; this object can be created by using New-AzureRmDataMigrationDatabaseInfo cmdlet.

maml:Description.maml:para: Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Database information
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The location of the Azure Database Migration Service instance.
The name of the project.
The name of the resource group.
The name of the Azure Database Migration Service instance.
Source Connection Info.
Source platform type for project.
Target connection information.
Target platform type for project.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Database information
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The location of the Azure Database Migration Service instance.
The name of the project.
The name of the resource group.
The name of the Azure Database Migration Service instance.
Source Connection Info.
Source platform type for project.
Target connection information.
Target platform type for project.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmDataMigrationProject -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroup -ServiceName TestService -ProjectName MyDMSProject -Location "central us" -SourceType SQL -TargetType SQLDB -SourceConnection $sourceConnInfo -TargetConnection $targetConnInfo -DatabaseInfo $dbList

dev:remarks.maml:para: The above example shows how to create new project named MyDMSProject located in Central US region under the Azure Database Migration Service instance named TestService.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new instance of the Azure Database Migration Service.

The New-AzureRmDataMigrationService cmdlet creates a new instance of the Azure Database Migration Service. This cmdlet takes in name of existing Azure Resource Group, the unique name for the new instance of the Azure Database Migration Service to be created, the region in which the instance is provisioned, the name of the DMS Worker SKU, and the name of the Azure Virtual Subnet on which the service is to reside. There is no parameter for subscription name, because it is expected for the user to specify the default subscription of the Azure login session or execute Get-AzureRmSubscription -SubscriptionName "MySubscription" | Select-AzureRmSubscription to select another subscription.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The location of the Azure Database Migration Service instance to be created, which corresponds to an Azure region.
The name of the resource group.
The name of the Azure Database Migration Service instance.
The sku for the Azure Database Migration Service instance. Possible values currently are Basic_1vCore,Basic_2vCores,GeneralPurpose_4vCores
The name of the subnet under the specified virtual network to use for the Azure Database Migration Service instance.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The location of the Azure Database Migration Service instance to be created, which corresponds to an Azure region.
The name of the resource group.
The name of the Azure Database Migration Service instance.
The sku for the Azure Database Migration Service instance. Possible values currently are Basic_1vCore,Basic_2vCores,GeneralPurpose_4vCores
The name of the subnet under the specified virtual network to use for the Azure Database Migration Service instance.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmDataMigrationService -ResourceGroupName myResourceGroup -ServiceName TestService -Location "Central US" -Sku Basic_2vCores -VirtualSubnetId $virtualSubNetId

dev:remarks.maml:para: The above example shows how to create a new instance of the Azure Database Migration Service named TestService in Central US region.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a MigrateSqlServerSqlDbDatabaseInput object that contains information about source and target databases for migration.

The New-AzureRmDataMigrationSqlServerSqlDbSelectedDB cmdlet creates a MigrateSqlServerSqlDbDatabaseInput object that contains information about source and target databases, as well as the table mappings, for migration. This cmdlet can be used as a parameter with the New-AzureRmDataMigrationTask cmdlet.

maml:Description.maml:para: Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Set Database to readonly before migration
The name of the database.
mapping of source to target tables
The name of the target Database.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Set Database to readonly before migration
The name of the database.
mapping of source to target tables
The name of the target Database.

dev:remarks.maml:para: The above example creates MigrateSqlServerSqlDbDatabaseInput object for migrating the AdventureWorks2016 database to a SQL Azure database with the same name.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates and starts a data migration task in the Azure Database Migration Service.

The New-AzureRmDataMigrationTask cmdlet creates data migration task. This cmdlet takes in parameters for Task Type enumerator, Azure Resource Group, name of associated Azure Data Migration Service and Project as input.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmDmsTask -TaskType MigrateSqlServerSqlDb -ResourceGroupName myResourceGroup -ServiceName TestService -ProjectName myDMSProject -TaskName MyMigrationTask -SourceConnection $sourceConnInfo -SourceCred $sourceCred -TargetConnection $targetConnInfo -TargetCred $targetCred -SelectedDatabase $selectedDbs

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example script shows how to create a new Data Migration Task named MyMigrationTask in the project named myDMSProject and service named TestService.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes an Azure Database Migration Service project from Azure.

The Remove-AzureRmDataMigrationProject cmdlet removes an Azure Database Migration Service project from Azure. Supplying the DeleteRunningTask parameter removes all of the Azure Database Migration Service tasks associated with the project that is being removed.

dev:remarks.maml:para: The above example removes the Azure Database Migration Service project called myDMProject from Azure based on name as input parameter
The above example removes the Azure Database Migration Service project based on PSProject object as input parameter.
